la.decomposition

Class EigenValueDecomposition

  • java.lang.Object
    • la.decomposition.EigenValueDecomposition

  • public class EigenValueDecomposition
extends java.lang.Object
    A Java implementation for the eigenvalue decomposition of a symmetric real matrix.

    The input matrix is first reduced to tridiagonal matrix and then is diagonalized by implicit symmetric shifted QR algorithm.

    Version:
    1.0 Dec. 19th, 2013
    Author:
    Mingjie Qian

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Matrix D
      A sparse diagonal matrix D with its diagonal being all eigenvalues in decreasing order (absolute value).

      Maximum number of iterations.

      Eigenvectors.

      • computeEigenvalues

        public static double[] computeEigenvalues(Matrix A)
        Only eigenvalues of a symmetric real matrix are computed.
        Parameters:
        A - a symmetric real matrix
        Returns:
        a 1D double array containing the eigenvalues in decreasing order (absolute value)

      • tridiagonalize

        private static Matrix[] tridiagonalize(Matrix A)
        Tridiagonalize a real symmetric matrix A, i.e. A = Q * T * Q' such that Q is an orthogonal matrix and T is a tridiagonal matrix.

        A = QTQ' <=> Q'AQ = T

        Parameters:
        A - a real symmetric matrix
        Returns:
        a Matrix array [Q, T]

      • tridiagonalize

        private static Matrix[] tridiagonalize(Matrix A,
                      boolean computeV)
        Tridiagonalize a real symmetric matrix A, i.e. A = Q * T * Q' such that Q is an orthogonal matrix and T is a tridiagonal matrix.

        A = QTQ' <=> Q'AQ = T

        Parameters:
        A - a real symmetric matrix
        computeV - if V is to be computed
        Returns:
        a Matrix array [Q, T]

      • unpack

        private static Matrix[] unpack(Matrix A,
              double[] a,
              double[] b,
              boolean computeV)
        Unpack Q and T from the result of tridiagonalization.
        Parameters:
        A - tridiagonalization result
        a - diagonal
        b - superdiagonal
        computeV - if V is to be computed
        Returns:
        a Matrix array [Q, T]

      • diagonalizeTD

        private static Matrix[] diagonalizeTD(Matrix T)
        Do eigenvalue decomposition for a real symmetric tridiagonal matrix, i.e. T = VDV'.
        Parameters:
        T - a real symmetric tridiagonal matrix
        Returns:
        a Matrix array [V, D]

      • diagonalizeTD

        private static Matrix[] diagonalizeTD(Matrix T,
                     boolean computeV)
        Do eigenvalue decomposition for a real symmetric tridiagonal matrix, i.e. T = VDV'.
        Parameters:
        T - a real symmetric tridiagonal matrix
        computeV - if V is to be computed
        Returns:
        a Matrix array [V, D]

      • quickSort

        private static void quickSort(double[] s,
             double[][] Vt,
             int start,
             int end,
             java.lang.String order,
             boolean computeV)
        Sort the eigenvalues in a specified order. If computeV is true, eigenvectors will also be sorted.
        Parameters:
        s - a 1D double array containing the eigenvalues
        Vt - eigenvectors
        start - start index (inclusive)
        end - end index (inclusive)
        order - a String either "descend" or "ascend"
        computeV - if V is to be computed

      • buildD

        private static Matrix buildD(double[] s,
            int m,
            int n)
        Build the diagonal matrix containing all eigenvalues.
        Parameters:
        s - eigenvalues
        m - number of rows
        n - number of columns
        Returns:
        a diagonal matrix containing all eigenvalues

      • implicitSymmetricShiftedQR

        private static void implicitSymmetricShiftedQR(double[] s,
                              double[] e,
                              double[][] Vt,
                              int i_start,
                              int i_end,
                              boolean computeV)
        Implicit symmetric shifted QR algorithm on B_hat which is the bottommost unreduced submatrix of B begin from i_start (inclusive) to i_end (inclusive).
        Parameters:
        s - diagonal elements
        e - superdiagonal elements
        Vt - transposition of eigenvector matrix
        i_start - start index of B_hat (inclusive)
        i_end - end index of B_hat (inclusive)
        computeV - if V is to be computed

      • update

        private static void update(double cs,
          double sn,
          double[] V1,
          double[] V2)
        Update two 1D double arrays V1 and V2 by Givens rotation parameterized by cs and sn, i.e. [V1 V2] * |cs -sn| or |cs sn| * |V1'| |sn cs| |-sn cs| |V2'|
        Parameters:
        cs - cos(theta)
        sn - sin(theta)
        V1 - a 1D double arrays
        V2 - a 1D double arrays
